TEI.2.document_title: Churchill Fulshear to Stephen F. Austin, 11-22-1824

barker_notes.barker_summary: Asking him to hire from Col. Groce a negro man.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 976

div1.p: Asking him to hire from Col. Groce a negro man.

Sir you will oblige me Very much If you can Higher me one Negro man for Two or three months of Col Groas that Can Cut and Split rails I Can pay you Twenty Dollars in Cash the Balence you must take Trade I wish you to git one and send on to me as quick as you Can as I am Not Able to Ride to see you this from yours to serve
[Addressed:] C° S F Auston St. P. D Austin
